This unit can increase its shooting accuracy for a short period of time.
This unit can increase its firing rate for a short period of time.

A large wall that can be erected during the deployment phase. It blocks the movement of enemies and protects against cavalry charges.
This unit can enter into a frenzied state for a short period of time, increasing its speed, morale, charge and melee attacks.
This unit can use blinding grenades to disorientate the enemy, affecting their speed, combat abilities and missile accuracy.
Increases campaign map movement.
These men use every fold of the land to conceal the route of their march, and are harder to spot on the campaign map.
Can exploit resources when placed at a trade post.
A short range anti-personnel munition.
This unit can only move at walking speed when limbered.
This unit can arrange itself into a moving circular formation, harrassing the enemy with a constant rate of fire.
An incendiary munition.
These men suffer less fatigue when fighting in a cold climate.
Increases ship speed.
An evolution of the wedge formation, the diamond formation is even more effective at disrupting enemy formations.
These men are better able to resist the sudden shocks of combat without breaking and running.
This unit can dismount to fight on foot then remount to quickly reposition.
Dropping your engines means your crew can move freely.||Usage of this is limited but may be useful if you have no other units to complete objectives or want to flee potential threats.
Explosive projectiles whose detonation is governed by a lit fuse.
Superb stamina makes these men tire less quickly.
This unit can advance by rank, claiming ground whilst maintaining a steady rate of fire.

This unit can fire flaming arrows for a short period of time. Flaming arrows have a greater damage effect and can set fire to flammable objects. The effect of flaming arrows is reduced in wet weather.
A thin-timbered hull provides little protection against a sustained cannonade.
These men are better than average at staying in one piece.
Packs sufficient firepower to trouble the heaviest opponent.
Steady hands and sharp eyes make for fine shots.
A strong esprit de corps unites these men, giving them high morale.
Constant repetition shaves fractions from loading times and helps to eliminate misfires.

These men are practiced in the use of grappling hooks to scale fort walls.
Can throw crude grenades to clear entrenchments and occupied buildings.
These men suffer less fatigue when fighting in a hot climate.
Once they have garrisoned a building, these men will lie low until the time is right to spring their ambush.
When stationary in long grass, these men will position themselves so as to be invisible to the enemy.
When stationary in light scrub, these men will position themselves so as to be invisible to the enemy.
When moving through wooded areas, units are hidden from enemy view.
This unit does not suffer a penalty against spear units.
This heroic body of men set an encouraging example to comrades nearby, making them less likely to rout.

This unit can be deployed outside of the deployment zone.
Spreading out to find cover helps to reduce casualties.
This unit employs long range weaponry.
Able to turn almost in its own length, this ship handles like a dream.
These men are effective at countering mounted opponents.
A defensive shield that can be erected during the deployment phase. It blocks the movement of enemies.
Explode on impact, thus less error-prone than conventional explosive shells.
The spear square is an immobile solid square of men presenting a wall of spears on all sides to deter cavalry attack.
A tight-packed formation presenting a wall of spears to the front to deter enemy cavalry attack.
Trained to fire in groups, or platoons, so as to maintain an unceasing fire on the enemy.
Provide melee bonuses, particularly against charging units, but prevent further firing once fixed.
The draconian techniques employed by these men when on garrison duty are highly effective at maintaining public order.
These projectiles burst to shower the target with caustic quicklime.

This general can rally nearby routing troops, returning them to the fray while boosting the morale of others.
This general can declare a rally position for withdrawing and routing units.
These men command sufficient respect to be able to rally their routing comrades.
This temporarily increases a unit's firing range.
Will fire by rank from front to rear, each rank kneeling to reload and allowing those behind a clear field of fire.
Increases a unit's movement speed for a short period of time.

Range and accuracy of cannons is improved.
Provide melee bonuses, particularly against charging units, but cause slower reloading when fixed.
The fierce appearance of these warriors is unnerving for those who must face them in battle.
The unfamiliar sight, sound and smell of a camel or elephant can unsettle enemy horses.
This restores a unit's stamina for a short period, allowing them to fight as if they were fresh to battle.
An air-burst munition which showers targets with metal fragments.
A skirmishing unit will retreat from enemies threatening their position.
These units are highly skilled and deadly missile infantry, allowing them to fire whilst remaining hidden.
Provide melee bonuses, particularly against charging units.
Can adopt a square formation to repel cavalry attacks at the cost of unit mobility.
These men can slowly stalk a target anywhere without giving away their position, though running or firing will draw attention.
This temporarily increases defence ability and stops morale from dropping, making the unit, and up to two nearby units, unbreakable for a short time.
Increased ship speed.
Unlimbering artillery allows you to set up an artillery position.||Limbering artillery allows you to move your artillery if you need to adjust the range, or make a tactical retreat.
Warcry heavily demoralises nearby enemies, slowing them down and affecting their defence ability for a short time.

The general dismounts and forms up with his bodyguard around him. All friendly units within a large area have their melee attack, firing rate and morale greatly increased, but the general himself is left immobile and vulnerable until the ability is deactivated.
Trained to charge in a wedge formation in order to better penetrate enemy formations.
As well as having normal arrow damage, whistling arrows have an unsettling effect on enemies they hit or fly over, reducing their combat ability for a short period.
Sharpened stakes can be used to deter enemy cavalry charges.
